title: Indie rock music: Blur and Sonic Youth
description:
Indie rock is a genre of alternative rock music that emerged in the 1980s. Its name is derived from "independent" as it refers to the independent labels that produced this style of music. This genre is characterized by its non-conformist and do-it-yourself attitude, challenging traditional commercial standards.
Indie rock has been associated with a wide range of subgenres, from jangly and upbeat pop-infused sounds to more experimental and introspective styles. Artists like Blur, Sonic Youth and Tame Impala have become iconic figures within the indie rock scene with their unique and innovative approaches.
Firstly influenced by UK Rock, Punk Rock, Funk and House, this particular genre continues to grow, embracing new influences and pushing boundaries, while still staying true to its independent roots.

dynamic_elements.table_query: SELECT DISTINCT ?band ?bandLabel ?influencedbyLabel ?country ?countryLabel WHERE { ?band wdt:P31 ?category ; wdt:P495 ?country ; wdt:P136 wd:Q183504 . ?category wdt:P279 wd:Q2088357 . ?others wdt:P737 ?band SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" } } LIMIT 10

dynamic_elements.chart_title: Most influential artists in the development of the  indie rock scene
dynamic_elements.chart_query: SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(distinct ?band) as ?count) WHERE { ?band wdt:P136 wd:Q183504 . ?band wdt:P737 ?influencer . SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". ?influencer rdfs:label ?label. } } GROUP BY ?label ?count ORDER BY DESC(?count) LIMIT 10

dynamic_elements.text: Blur, a British rock band formed in 1988, is renowned as one of the pioneers of the Britpop movement that dominated the UK music scene in the 1990s. Consisting of frontman Damon Albarn, guitarist Graham Coxon, bassist Alex James, and drummer Dave Rowntree, Blur effortlessly combined elements of indie rock, pop, and alternative music, creating a distinct and influential sound.

dynamic_elements.table_query: SELECT DISTINCT ?member ?memberLabel ?image WHERE { wd:Q485820 wdt:P527 ?member . OPTIONAL { ?member wdt:P18 ?image . } SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" } } LIMIT 4

dynamic_elements.text:
Their breakthrough came with the release of their third studio album, "Parklife," in 1994. The album marked a significant shift in their style, encapsulating the spirit of British culture and delivering catchy anthems with witty, observational lyrics. The success of "Parklife" propelled Blur and the Britpop movement into the mainstream, subsequently leading them to sell millions of records worldwide.

Today, Blur's legacy as one of the most influential and innovative bands of their era remains undeniable, with their distinctive blend of genres continuing to inspire musicians around the globe

dynamic_elements.table_title: Albums by the band Blur and release year
dynamic_elements.table_query: SELECT ?album ?albumLabel ?year ?yearLabel WHERE { ?band wdt:P31 wd:Q215380. ?band rdfs:label "Blur"@en. ?album wdt:P31 wd:Q482994. ?album wdt:P175 ?band. ?album wdt:P577 ?year. SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } } ORDER BY DESC (?year)

dynamic_elements.text:
Another influential and innovative band in alternative and indie rock history is the band Sonic Youth. Hailing from New York City, Sonic Youth's unique blend of experimental sounds and unconventional song structures pushed the boundaries of rock music while inspiring generations of musicians. Let's dive into a deeper understanding of this revolutionary band!

Sonic Youth's founding members are Thurston Moore, Kim Gordon, Lee Ranaldo, and Steve Shelley. Their music had a huge impact on the alternative and grunge scenes of the 90s, influencing bands like Nirvana, Pearl Jam, and Smashing Pumpkins. The band worked as pioneer in alternative rock, shaping the future of independent music, and has been central in the democratization of music-making, inspiring artists to explore unconventional sounds and challenge musical norms. From their early noise-driven days to their later experimentation and mainstream success, Sonic Youth consistently pushed boundaries and paved the way for countless artists to follow. Their legacy remains intact, forever changing the landscape of indierock music.

dynamic_elements.table_query: SELECT DISTINCT ?member ?memberLabel ?image WHERE { wd:Q188626 wdt:P527 ?member . OPTIONAL { ?member wdt:P18 ?image . } SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" } } LIMIT 5
SELECT ?recordLabel ?recordLabelLabel WHERE { wd:Q188626 wdt:P264 ?recordLabel. SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } }

dynamic_elements.chart_title: Number of nomination of the band Sonic Youth
dynamic_elements.chart_query: SELECT ?label WHERE { ?sonic ?a wd:Q188626 . ?sonic wdt:P1411 ?nomination . SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". ?nomination rdfs:label ?label. } } LIMIT 10
